data.title: [Request] Allow a keybinding for "Maximize/Restore panel size" in the terminal panel.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1

[Feature request]
I would like to be able to bind a key shortcut to the "Maximize panel size" option in integrated terminal.
I like to glance over my test results without scrolling through the terminal and not having to click the maximize /restore button would make my life way easier. I could not find a keybind option in VS Code itself or any mention through google etc. 
The button in question:
![maximize_restore_panel](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6343126/29628922-098cc470-8805-11e7-9520-7dd43cd1ef84.PNG)

I have an extension that is causing a lot of problems. One of them is that it keeps giving me a notification. But I don't know which extension is giving me this notification and is causing the other problems I'm facing. This notification comes at random so I can't reproduce it, nor can I disable the extensions 1 by 1 to find it if it will come again.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/791996/29628810-726979ee-87eb-11e7-8014-8b841f52080b.png)

Edit: The above error message appears when I change themes. I can't change themes anymore because by user settings file has been corrupted by some extension. That extension throws an error notification that I submitted an issue for before [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/31596). 


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: When starting to debug hosted SPFx receiving ""hamburgerCallback must not be undefined"
data.body:
Since yesterday morning, NZ-time, when I start to debug my hosted SPFx webpart, I receive two exceptions.  After "ignoring"/F5 the exceptions, it seems to run sweet. 

First exception:

    Error: ***The value for "hamburgerCallback" must not be undefined
       at Function.e.isNotNullOrUndefined (https://spoprod-a.akamaihd.net/files/sp-client-prod_2017-08-11.019/sp-webpart-workbench-assembly_en-us_1103575b589894e6f7c32232400ee52c.js:273:1058)
       at e.get [as hamburgerCallback] (https://spoprod-a.akamaihd.net/files/sp-client-prod_2017-08-11.019/sp-webpart-workbench-assembly_en-us_1103575b589894e6f7c32232400ee52c.js:1276:17281)
       at e._onRender (https://spoprod-a.akamaihd.net/files/sp-client-prod_2017-08-11.019/sp-webpart-workbench-assembly_en-us_1103575b589894e6f7c32232400ee52c.js:1262:22876)
       at https://spoprod-a.akamaihd.net/files/sp-client-prod_2017-08-11.019/sp-webpart-workbench-assembly_en-us_1103575b589894e6f7c32232400ee52c.js:1262:22699
       at https://r1.res.office365.com/o365/versionless/shellcoreprimeg2m_1a333542.js:22:15411

Second exception:

    Error: Sys.InvalidOperationException: Operation is not valid due to the current state of the object.
        at Function.Error.create (https://r1.res.office365.com/o365/versionless/shellcoreming2am_90c8efd1.js:65:13)
        at Function.Error.invalidOperation (https://r1.res.office365.com/o365/versionless/shellcoreming2am_90c8efd1.js:137:19)
        at Function._o365cl.a.b (https://r1.res.office365.com/o365/versionless/shellcoreming2am_90c8efd1.js:2479:12319)
        at _o365sg2c.r.b.f (https://r1.res.office365.com/o365/versionless/shellcoreprimeg2m_1a333542.js:20:1641)
        at _o365sg2c.r.a (https://r1.res.office365.com/o365/versionless/shellcoreprimeg2m_1a333542.js:20:858)

```
#!/bin/bash
CONT=`cat <<-END1 | wc -l

echo "$CONT"
```

data.title: Mismatched types for "editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter" user setting
data.body:
editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter used to be a boolean, but now expects a string, and this change broke my UserSettings and wasn't really documented anywhere that I could find.

Suggestion: `true`/`false` map to `"on"` and `"off"`, or update [the Intellisense documentation (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/intellisense)](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/intellisense) with the new options.

I'm not entirely sure whether this qualifies as a simple documentation issue or a real bug, but I'm reporting it here because I don't know where else to do so.

- VSCode Version: 1.14.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04LTS, last update 8/18/17

data.title: Prompt to install extension from external link re-appears after reloading editor window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
vscode-es-beautifier|dai|1.0.0
gitlens|eam|4.4.0
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-angular2-emmet|jak|2.0.3
vscode-text-pastry|jkj|1.1.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.8
autoimport|ste|1.2.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code
2. Go to marketplace.visualstudio.com, navigate to an extension, and click "Install". VS Code should come into focus with "Would you like to install XX extension?" prompt showing
3. Install the extension
4. Click the "Reload" button to reload the VS Code window and enable the extension.
5. When VS Code re-loads the "Would you like to install...." prompt re-appears. Expected behavior is that it would not re-appear.

Additionally, when you go through this process for multiple extensions, when VS Code reloads the prompts stack, showing multiple outdated prompts.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/813192/29617425-d4769080-87e2-11e7-8152-fefe501e42a1.png)

data.title: Scrolling is slow and choppy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:05:38.342Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vue|liu|0.1.5
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.8
vetur|oct|0.9.5
sass-indented|rob|1.4.1



---

After installing the latest update scrolling is super laggy and slow. Happens even with extensions disabled. Not a problem with my PC, everything else is fine. 

I made a 20 second video comparing scrolling through a 65 line file in VS Code and a page in Edge.

https://1drv.ms/v/s!Ans0By3xg-0wleVZPgQOO0kipJw6AA

 For both I'm just using a fast back and forth 2 finger scroll gesture on my trackpad. In Edge the content tracks with my fingers with no perceptible lag and feels immediate. In code there's a good half second delay before it even starts responding and when it does it jumps around randomly instead of matching my fingers.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Attempt to scroll through a file
2. Observe slow and choppy scrolling

While you are fixing this, how can I revert to the previous build?

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes!

Sublime Text doesn't have this behavior.

```
{

```

2. Double click files name  **a.txt** and **b.txt** in left panel
3. Close vscode

5. Enter D:\NewFolder
6.  Open **test** folder with vscode by right click
7. **a.txt** and **b.txt** files not opened automatically

data.title: Integrated terminal fails to load PowerShell on macOS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: stable or insiders
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. make sure to have PowerShell on macOS (I use version v6.0.0-beta.5)
2. add setting: `"terminal.integrated.shell.osx": "/usr/local/bin/powershell",`
3. try to create a new Integrated Terminal

Observe: for a brief moment this error appears and then the terminal closes:

![2017-08-23_12-15-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29611182-e4ad2e9a-87fc-11e7-94fa-7feac0ee3835.png)

I had to record a screencast in order to be able to see the error message.
After that it became clear that the culprit is the default argument '-l' being passed to PowerShell.
With this setting `"terminal.integrated.shellArgs.osx": []` PowerShell starts up fine.

data.title: Unit test coverage for multi root configuration

data.title: Launch program in integratedTerminal failing if using powershell and path to runtimeExecutable contains spaces
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0-insider commit 1c6f2f9a8012565adcc50616c3aa90cb444e8797
- OS Version: Windows 10 Insider build 16257

If you use PowerShell as your default shell for the integrated terminal and specify a runtimeExecutable with spaces in it's path, two things might happen:
1. If you don't specify runtimeArgs, the console will just echo the path for the executable
2. If you specify runtimeArgs, the command will fail with `Unexpected Token in expression or statement`

This happens because if there's a space in the path, the path is put into quotes. However in PowerShell, if you enclose the path in quotes, it gets evaluated as a string and not as an executable, For the file to be executed, the path string has to be prepended with a `&` symbol, so for example `'C:\Program Files (x86)\Yarn\bin\yarn.cmd' start` becomes `& 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Yarn\bin\yarn.cmd' start`.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a launch config
2. Set `request: "launch"` and `runtimeExecutable: <executable with a space in it's path>`
3. Hit F5

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature request: allow skipFiles: "<eval>/*" pattern
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set `"skipFiles": ["node_modules/**", "<node_internals>/*", "<eval>/*"]` in `launch.json`
2. Use debugger to debug TypeScript or JavaScript
3. Eval scripts still stop the debugger

It would be nice if `<eval>/*` could be supported as a skip pattern just like `<node_internals>/*`. Apologies if I'm posting this in the wrong place!

data.title: "Submit a bug" should include the command line and remove extensions if launched with --disable-extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The "report a bug" button opens a window with all the extensions filled in, which is great. But if you open code with all extensions disabled there is no indication of this in the pregenerated text.

It seems reasonable to not include the list of extensions at all and just say "Code was launched with all extensions disabled".

In addition it'd make sense I think to include all the command line options passed.

data.title: VS Code Insiders crashes on every exit on Windows
data.body:
* (with Electron 1.7.5)
* open VS Code
* close VS Code
* Observe in process explorer that there is a crash and the crash is presented in the Windows Event Log.

data.title: Use 'modifiedStop' instead of 'modifiedStart' in line 863 of diff.ts
data.body:
This is a fix to what looks like a copy-paste mistake in diff.ts.

I was testing a new linting rule ([no-dead-store](https://github.com/SonarSource/SonarTS/blob/master/docs/rules/no-dead-store.md)) on vscode and I got pointed to an [unused assignment](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/de13fec877f790b41ff6be56fda8f47d524e925f/src/vs/base/common/diff/diff.ts#L849) of `modifiedStop` in diff.ts. Another rule ([no-identical-expressions](https://github.com/SonarSource/SonarTS/blob/master/docs/rules/no-identical-expressions.md)) points to a binary expression with [two identical operands](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/de13fec877f790b41ff6be56fda8f47d524e925f/src/vs/base/common/diff/diff.ts#L863) on both sides: `modifiedStart`. This makes me think that what was meant was `modifiedStart < modifiedStop`.

data.title: Emmet update ruined my experience
data.body:
I used to be, until last update on July, that I used Emmet in the most elegant way - writing my emmet snippets and whenever I want after that I pressed the tab key, and as long as the text cursor was after the Emmet, it worked.
After the update, whenever I want to Emmet I need to check if an abbreviation is showing(which it isn't sometimes) and then press tab.

So certain behaviors like going to css file, writing bgc and pressing tab or simply HTML .class`ing is ruind for me.

data.title: Indentation error when I pasting blocks of code in editor.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: mac os 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

![ezgif com-video-to-gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16359169/29606694-9d1691be-8821-11e7-9ffc-dee11134d5dd.gif)
